intro: Marrubium africanum f. flavescens, commonly known as the African white horehound, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small, pale blue to white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is often found in Mediterranean and subtropical climates, where it thrives in well-drained soils. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
